Posts.Content: I am a 63 year old (soon to be 64) white male. In August 2012, after experiencing a difficult time urinating, I sought a urologist. My PSA result was 50.11 A biopsy confirmed 6 of 10 samples were positive. CT and bone scans were negative. A Gleason score of 8. The doctor claims I'm a candidate for either surgery (removal of the prostate) or seed/hormone therapy. Would someone please be so kind and share their experiences with the "seed" therapy? Advice would be greatly appreciated - I thank you in advance.
Posts.Title: Hello Everyone

Posts.Content: Hi Chuck and thank you for the reply, The Dr. DID say the urination problem was due to an elarged prostate. I have a scheduled meeting with the Radiation Oncology Specialist the Monday after Thanksgiving. The enlarged prostate question you suggested will definitely be asked. Thank You.
Posts.Title: Hello Everyone

Posts.Content: Hi JohnT and thanks for the reply, As posted earlier, a meeting with the Radiation Oncology Specialist is scheduled. This is exactly the topic the urologist and surgeon have concerns - cancer is not contained. Therefore, they suggested the seed therapy. Do you know if the seed therapy is ALWAYS accompanied with hormone therapy? Thank You.
Posts.Title: Hello Everyone
